newsitem.title: UK: RTZ falls with market, production healthy.
newsitem.headline: RTZ falls with market, production healthy.

text.p: Shares in RTZ Corp Plc, the British arm of mining group RTZ-CRA, fell 11 pence to 928 on Wednesday in line with a weaker overall market, despite the release of favourable production figures.

Referring to rises of respectively 33 and 34 percent in 1996 fourth quarter copper and gold production, analyst Emile Morfett at Paribas Capital Markets said: "This is a set of cracking production results."

Another analyst, who declined to be named, said the figures were broadly as expected. The only negative he detected was news of continuing problems with the Bingham Canyon copper smelter in the U.S., which became operational in June 1995.
"That is not exactly new news, but it shows it is a project which is taking quite some time to de-bug."
RTZ-CRA said output from the flash converting furnace remained below expectations due to bottlenecks in the anode refining and casting facilities.
But the flash smelting furnace was now performing near design capacity, RTZ-CRA said.
